column4: Small business owners & employees continue to face an uphill climb as we recover from this pandemic. At an Economic Development Lunch in Yakima, I spoke with community leaders & local officials about the challenges facing businesses in #WA04 & how I can support them in Congress. https://t.co/JnBEUiVzlH

I met with healthcare professionals and local officials in Yakima to discuss their needs and challenges heading into the winter months.

More from @kimatv: https://t.co/6F1vd70ZOg

‚ÄúThe gray wolf has successfully recovered, and...locally-led conservation, with the support of local conservation districts, will continue to ensure the species will not return to ESA‚Äôs endangered or threatened list.‚Äù Tim Palmer, @NACDconserve

The @ChelanDouglasHD has been working to protect individuals & families throughout NCW. In East Wenatchee, we discussed their important focus on getting COVID-19 safety info to Hispanic & agricultural communities. https://t.co/cjevcBfrUf
Yesterday, I met with Douglas Co. business owners & @WVChamber to learn how businesses & employees are adapting to pandemic restrictions. https://t.co/71JVqnnM4E

I am in Okanogan County today! 

‚úÖ First stop: Afternoon meeting with local healthcare officials at Mid-Valley Hospital. Rural communities face unique healthcare challenges, which is why hearing from rural healthcare professionals is so critical during the pandemic & beyond. https://t.co/udgjPF2hEm

Last week, I hosted a meeting with Benton, Franklin, & Walla Walla County officials to discuss current and upcoming healthcare needs as we continue to combat the COVID-19 pandemic. 

More from @kimatv: https://t.co/WZDwGcISrV

This morning, I visited with members of @BFHD & @WWCDCH to discuss their needs as Congress works on additional pandemic relief. Moving into winter, a coordinated effort and recovery plan will be key to beating this virus in #WA04. https://t.co/jnUSF8SAws

And that‚Äôs a wrap! Thank you to all of the business owners who opened their doors to me & shared how they are working to support the community of Connell through the COVID-19 pandemic and beyond. #ConnellMainStreetTour

Imagination Station is the only licensed daycare facility in Connell. During the pandemic, staff took voluntary pay cuts to keep the doors open for children & families, which shows true dedication to their community. #ConnellMainStreetTour https://t.co/xTH1FpHMn7
After opening this location 4 years ago, Dayanna‚Äôs Salon struggled through state lockdowns, but she is excited to safely engage with customers again. #ConnellMainStreetTour https://t.co/mnQkVaQ36q
For decades, the Connell Small Mall has been bringing local vendors together in one place. Business snapped back when COVID-19 restrictions were lifted. #ConnellMainStreetTour https://t.co/Z6R54XxTpB
Pizza Station survived the economic lockdowns - like many local restaurants across #WA04 - through curbside pickup and by starting a delivery service. #ConnellMainStreetTour https://t.co/mGM4Ll0mUf

Last stop: #ConnellMainStreetTour! I visited with small business owners to see firsthand how they have adapted their businesses to comply with pandemic regulations while supporting the local economy in Connell. https://t.co/Gs0LdEuGUq

Down to rural Franklin County where I met with City of Connell officials to learn how they are applying state COVID-19 regulations to their targeted local response. Thank you for your hard work keeping the community of Connell safe & healthy! https://t.co/a58qTmCDA6

My next stop in Adams County is an Economic Development Lunch at Casa Mexicana with local officials & leaders. Small businesses in rural communities have struggled to survive shutdowns & keeping up with pandemic protocols, but together, we can forge a path to economic recovery. https://t.co/tbbPU2a7UQ

I am starting today meeting with the Adams County Health Department & local healthcare officials at @CBHA_WA. I am encouraged by their dedication to working with schools, businesses & local government to develop a comprehensive COVID-19 recovery strategy + fight pandemic fatigue. https://t.co/F95L6HmWEC
Now for the #QuincyMainStreetTour! I am touring around Quincy to learn about new & developing projects and hear firsthand about COVID-19 impacts on our local economy.

Lunch stop: I was joined by local leaders to discuss economic development in Grant Co. Their insight into the needs of small businesses & local schools is invaluable as we explore future pandemic relief and navigate into economic recovery. https://t.co/mWKFlV2rdi

I am in Grant County today to learn more about how I can help promote the public & economic health of Central Washington in Congress. 

‚úÖ First stop: Meeting with healthcare officials from @GCHD_WA in Moses Lake! https://t.co/0E3ZXflo2l

We discussed the impacts COVID-19 & the recent wildfires have had on our agriculture industry + ongoing conservation projects. I am grateful for the support of @BillAtUSDA & his team for helping #WA04 farmers & ranchers through these difficult times.
I strongly support the Trillion Trees Initiative & this Executive Order from President @realDonaldTrump solidifies the U.S. commitment to healthier forests and cleaner air. https://t.co/MjLSYQAiAO

As wildfires burn across the West, it is the federal government's responsibility to give our local communities the tools they need to manage our lands and create healthy, resilient forests and grasslands. https://t.co/4qNRDXhcM4

With an economic impact of over $700 million in #WA04 alone, the beer industry showcases the best that Central Washington has to offer ‚Äì from highlighting our nation‚Äôs largest hop growing region to creating tourism opportunities for visitors from around the world.
